text.__SUMMARY__: Diospyros montana, the Bombay ebony, is a small deciduous tree in the ebony family up to 15 metres (49 ft) tall, distributed all along the Western Ghats of India, Sri Lanka, Indo-China through to Australia.
text.Common names:
English – Mountain persimmon, mottled ebony
Malayalam – Manjakara, Nanchimaram, Bali, Malayakathitholi
Tamil – Karunthuvalisu, Vakanai, Vakkanatthi
Other Indian – Bistendu, Jagalkanti, Manjakara, Bankini, Vakkanai, Malayakathitholi
Vietnamese - thị da đen
